title: Britain eases visa rules for Chinese visitors
text:
Britain eases visa rules for Chinese visitors 21 Oct 2015 at 20:59 2,112 viewed 3 comments WRITER: AP 
Supporters of Chinese President Xi Jinping, hold onto the national flag of China and the national flag of Britain as they wait in the rain for his arrival outside Downing Street in London on Wednesday. (AP photo) - + 
UK tourism LONDON â€” Britain has used the state visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping as an occasion to ease visa requirements for other Chinese visitors. 
Prime Minister David Cameron's office said Wednesday that standard visitor visas will be extended from six months to two years as part of the government's plan to strengthen ties with China. 
Plans for a new 10-year multiple entry visa were also announced. 
The extended visa will be introduced in January. 
Officials say Chinese tourists contribute 500 million pounds (27 billion baht) to Britain's economy each year. 
London tourism officials said the new rules should deliver a boost to tourism. 
The Chinese president arrived in Britain Monday for a four-day state visit as part of a push to increase trade ties between the two countries.
